climbs.name: Velvet Sky
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb the left edge of a brown face to a stance below an obvious arête. Work the arête and corner to a tough pull onto a steep brown face.  Finish with a couple of tough stabs into the correct choice of finger pockets.

climbs.name: Social Distancing
climbs.fa: Jake Burton; bolted by Eric Bluemn

content.description: Short but powerful.  Boulder up through a big roof and climb a right facing corner.  Easier climbing leads to the top.
content.location: Walk downhill from the access gate to the Pit.  Currently second route from the right.  Has name tag at the base.

climbs.name: Runaway
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Starts just right of Redneck Recycling Center, move up and left to a stance that shares a couple holds with Red Neck Recycling Center.  Then move right to a small roof. Make hard moves through the roof to a short face with a couple more pumpy moves that lead to a ledge and the anchors.  Fun boulder problem crux.

climbs.name: Redneck Recycling Center
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start behind a boulder near the detached pillar and climb through stacked blocks to a broad, smooth face. Crimp up a few moves to gain a corner system. Work up the corner and pull left to the anchors.

climbs.name: Pumpster Diving
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Move up and right until you can pull over a bulge and gain a stance on a sloping shelf.  Crimp up a move or two until you can grab blocky good holds. Work slightly left then pull right to nice looking brown rock with a long flake jammed into a corner. Climb past the hollow flake and continue to the anchors just left of large roof.

climbs.name: Pick Your Poison
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb up easy moves to a broken roof band and move up on mostly decent holds.  Continue up until you can work a slighly curving vertical crack.  Make a big reach to a jug and pull your feet up to a stance.  Easier but fun face climbing to the right leads to the anchors.   This is a great route with about 20 feet of continuous pumpy climbing.

climbs.name: One Trick Pony
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Face climb up brown stone to a ledge. Continue up to a cream colored face right of a short arête. Using the flared slot in the roof, pull through to a stance over the roof.  Pretty much one hard move on what is otherwise a very moderate climb.

Appears 11+ or 12 something.  Shares first two bolts with JJ1.  After the second bolt, face climb right over the bulge on thin edges and side-pulls.  Finish on independent anchor.  FA thought to be Joel Jackson.

climbs.name: In Your Face
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Boulder up to a shelf and a large ledge.  Continue up a white face to a three foot roof.  Pull the roof into a shallow tan corner and climb to the anchors.

climbs.name: Heartbreaker
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Shares the first bolt with JJ1 and then moves left through overhanging rock with a series of big moves until mantling on to a narrow stance.  Easier rock leads to the anchors.
content.location:
<not pictured>

About 60 feet downhill and right of the access gate.

climbs.name: Ground Zero
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Starts from the shelf below the detached pillar.  After a couple moves, step up and gain a burly lieback/undercling until you can reach a good horizontal hold. Grab a flake and pull onto a short headwall then move right to the anchors on easy ground.  Shares anchors with Redneck Recycling Center.

climbs.name: Finger Dance
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Scramble up to the shelf below the detached pillar. This is the left most route accessed from the shelve below the detached pillar.  Small crimps, thin tips and stemming leads to a small roof. Continue to the anchors on decent but pumpy holds.

climbs.name: Dust in the Wind
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: After clipping the second bolt, make a committing move to a stance below a small bulge.  Find a couple key crimps and move up and left to blocky holds.   Continue up and slightly left to a hueco and a lieback flake.  Make a move hard right and up to a stance.  Pull on to a short headwall  with  good holds but bad feet to a comfortable stance and the anchors.

climbs.name: Bold in the Bathtub
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start in a short, dirty corner and move right. Continue up on easy, blocky rock to a stance just below steeper rock with thin holds.  Stem up to an overhang.  Work up through the roof to a nice corner capped with a small triangular roof.  Stem up and work holds on the right side until you can reach the anchors.

climbs.name: Beer Thirty
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: About 30 feet right of the JJ routes, scramble up a loose ramp to the first bolt. Climb up to a thin crack that goes through a small bulge. Continue up to the anchors.

climbs.name: Alzheimers
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Just downhill from the gate into TBC, there is a short attractive shallow cream colored corner that leads to small bulge and a few moves up a blunt arête. 5 bolts.  This route has not seen a clean ascent yet.  Thought to be around 12 b or c.  Post a comment with the grade if you send it.
